bio:treatment.discussion: Section Marginatae is a sharply delimited taxon characterized primarily by strongly modified innermost perichaetial leaves that have the areolation in the distal half composed of cells with strongly incrassate walls. Additionally, the basal cells of vegetatvie leaves are esinuose with markedly incrassate lateral walls, the distal cells tend to be elongate, and the basal marginal border is present and is composed of pellucid, esinuose cells.
